We ended up ordering the poo poo platter for two which had a sampler of the following; a whole fish, bbq chicken (this was the best dish of all) lumpia, steamed rice (even though we asked for garlic rice instead but guess they forgot) sweet yams and pork along with some veggies. 

Service here is very polite and courteous! Not once did they try to rush us and regularly checked in to see how we were enjoying everything. 

If you do come here, go before dark (the area is a bit sketchy) and go for the platter where you get to try everything. I highly recommend them for their bbq chicken, lumpia and catering!
author: Petra S.

description:
This place is a hidden gem! I highly recommend this restaurant. I drove into the city to visit my mom and grandfather and wanted to bring food. I usually go to the same few Filipino places near his house to ensure the food is still warm when I deliver it. This place is further away from Daly City but by the looks of the pics and reviews on Yelp it's well worth it. I called to see if they sell the Kamayan feasts for take out and they happily said YES WE DO!!!! They also let me know this is a cash only establishment.  
    When I arrived I was greeted by the staff and noticed the ATM was broken. I was kindly directed to walk to the corner donut shop where they have a working ATM. The donut place was great so I ended up buying some of those too lol!  Anyway, when I got back to the restaurant They were packing up our feast. I told them to please be sure that everything is perfect because my grandfather will tell me I should of went to his favorite place.  They were so pleasant and accommodating.  The food was absolutely delicious and came with extra banana leaves in the shape of plates for everyone to have their own to eat off of. My grandfather said the meal was made and presented to perfection and wanted to know what restaurant I got it from. I'm so pleased that he was impressed. I will be back again and again.
author: Chanel D.

description: This place was pretty good. It definitely has then wow factor with the Kamayan style meal. The 6 person meal was plenty. I was full and satisfied. Also it is affordable and reasonable. I would come again.
author: Grace O.

description:
16.12.00             incomplete review
                           Had the pleasure of trying out the 2 skewers
                           It was an quick hit and run tryout

Pork Skewer & Chicken Skewer  
   Both was $2.50 and cooked right.
   Portion was huge for $2.50 ... 
   I can easily make 2 moderate size sandwiches! 
   The portion size caught me by surprise
       could have ordered just one for snacking ... glad I didn't save the other for later.

Can't wait to try the main entrees ... after trying the skewers!
The only reason I haven't revisit them sooner ...
    I lived cross town ... just happen to be in the area or I would visit it once a week!
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Are you ready to get your hands all grubby but feast like a King? That's what someone should've asked me before I ate here. When a few friends mentioned dinner plans in the City & asked if I wanted to tag along, I said sure. I had no idea what I was in for. 

Anyhow, we showed up on a chilly Saturday night. I got lucky & scored nearby street parking upon arrival. Walking in, it was about 1/2 full. We were greeted & seated immediately. Altogether, there were 5 of us. Again, as far as ordering, I had no idea.

I've had some Filipino food before, but never Kamayan. Fortunately, 2 of our party were Filipino, & Kamayan was specifically why they'd chosen this place. Since there isn't a 5-person size on their menu, we opted for the 6-person size.

Considering the enormity of the mountain of food that appeared at our table, our order really did not take long at all. Like a bunch of sophisticated savages, we dug in with our bare hands. There's definitely a technique to rolling up all the tasty morsels into tidy bite-sizes & popping it into your mouth.

What an array of wondrously diverse deliciousness on that banana leaf platter. & there was so much of all of it. We were the 5 who ate as 6. But either way, 5 or 6, it was still more food for the $ per person than you'll find most of the time in SF.

So while my hands got all grubby & coated with the tasty juices of our meal, to the point of multiple hand-washings not completely eliminating that Kamayan odor, I absolutely feasted like a King! & on the cheap! Would I do it again? You bet.

Who knows? Maybe with enough practice I could get good at scooping up well-composed bites with my bare hands. & for a bonus, they have karaoke. If that's your thing, tune up those pipes. They're game to let anyone belt out a tune or 2.
author: John M.

description: Good place to have dinner with the family. The decorations make you feel like you are in the Philippines. I recommend the Kamayan for 6 people but enough for 8 people. The food is not salty or oily like other Filipino restaurants. The service is fast and friendly and they treat you like family. Everyone loved the food.
author: Marc T.

description:
My 1st time here & I ordered 4 diff. individual order + 1 dish on the side to go. Cashier was writing down all my orders & computing everything in her little pad. I thought okay weird she has to keep looking @the menu for the prices & did the math on the pad itself but whatever. So then she said sit down & wait for the order (I paid already). Mind you it wasn't busy inside or anything. They could at least offer me some water or anything but none. On top of that the cashier walked by & then asked me if I ordered already to her own realization that yes I did but she goes on & asked me if I paid already & asks for the receipt. I had to get everything out of my wallet in front of her looking for a receipt annoyed as hell & to finally realized she never gave me 1. So then she says oh yes that's right, your good! 

When I got home we ate the food, it was so-so except the sisig is REALLY good. I give them that. But when we we're looking at the prices on their online menu I realized they charged me WAY more for the whole order 'cause I'm pretty sure tax could not have been $10+! So thanks a lot for the great exp. Never going back there again!
author: Gem C.

description: First time being here and the food was great and fresh. Our server was nice and attentive definitely I'm going to go back here again next time with a larger group.
author: Mike T.

description: the different dishes by itself is three star a-ok, but Im a fan of appetizer plates and this is like a mealetizer plate, so Im a fan, wish they san miguel or something though.
author: Phuc B.

description: Great customer service and food was amazing. Cost is very affordable. Just know it's cash only. They have an ATM inside the restaurant to make it easier! The combo for a group is way more than enough. We came with 2 adults and 2 little kids and still had so much to take home!! Pampangas best! Salamat
author: Gerry M.

description: I had pampanguena cuisine for an event for my company and Josie (and staff) did an AMAZING JOB! Everyone at the event loved the food I ordered. Great service and great food, what else can you ask for?
author: Stacy M.

description:
Amazing!  Did I say amazing?!?  Guided by an experienced hand, my Filipino friend Will. 

I had BBQ Pork Skewer. The perfect balance of sweet, meaty, and grilled. Cooked perfectly. I ordered Longannisa sausage on the side because I had to try it, and it didn't disappoint.

We also had Pancit which was ok. Kinda salty. 

Everything was made from scratch. The owners were SO friendly. Food was awesome, authentic, and made with love. 

Will be back!
author: Paul G.

description:
4 Stars.....
PAMPANGUENA CUISINE is truly an authentic, Filipino Restaurant, located in the Excelsior District of San Francisco.

Heard alot of "buzz" about this place, and have been anxious to give it a try.  It also helps when you love Filipino food, which I truly do.  On a lazy early Thursday evening, 4 of us decided to pay PAMPANGUENA a visit.
Parking can be a bit challenging but much to our surprise, snagged a parking spot across the street.  SCORE!

Once we were inside, and seated, we looked over the Menu.  It was pretty much apparent we were going with the "Kamayan" style dinner for 6. Although there was 4 in our party, they do not have a platter for 5, so naturally, we were afraid of not enough food, so we ordered the platter for 6. OMG!  Never underestimate a Filipino cook. Tons of food!  Our platter consisted of the following:

Grilled Tilapia
Grilled Squid
Grilled Pork
Flitter Shrimp
Salted Egg
Lumpia Shanghai​
Mango/Tomato/Onion
Steamed Vegetables
Sweet Yam
Steamed Rice

A la carte, we also ordered (again, for fear of lack of food) Pancit Bihon and Sizzling Sisig.
For dessert, we enjoyed Halo Halo. Our two Beverage​ of choices were the Coconut juice and the Mango juice.  First of all, the food is very fresh and beautifuly presented. What an array of diverse deliciousness on that banana leaf platter, and there was so much of it!  Sure, we were the 4 who ate as 6, but either way, 5 or 6, it is still more for the $ per person than you'll find most of the time in SF.  It not only was exceptionally tasteful, it was also well balanced from different textures, crunchy, crispy, chewy to flavors from tangy, savory, salty & sweet. Also, despite the rarity of eating with your hands (although they are happy to provide utensils, when asked), I might become an "expert" at scooping up well composed bites of the platter food, instead of worried about the mess I was making. Practice does make perfect. Lol.

We sure did eat like a group of starving teenagers, who just came home from school, and left no evidence behind that a scene was committed. In essence, you won't go home hungry. And you might have some leftovers.

PAMPANGUENA CUISINE is a Fabulous hidden gem. The owners are super nice, and you can tell they have love with their passion for the business.

It's not a fancy restaurant, but it is a casual, relaxed atmosphere.

My one complaint?  Maybe PLEASE don't be a 'cash only' operation.  Nobody likes to pay cash today. It would be beneficial to both you and your customers.
author: Janet T.

description:
My first time coming here and it was definitely a good experience! I never had kamayan before but it was really delicious. We ordered two large plates and there was 11 of us and it filled us good!  My stomach was about to explode after eating all of this yummy food. 

Good service and good food definitely deserves a 5 star. I will definitely be back to try other things on the menu as well.
author: Monica W.

description:
This place was featured in Adobo Nation (Filipino show) and the foods featured looks good. We finally decided to try and was very disappointed. 
1st- The place looks dirty and unorganized
2nd - The TV was so loud that you barely can hear each other's conversation
3rd - the food is okay
I gave 2 stars because we asked to substitute the Tilapia fish to Squid and was accommodated to our request for an additional $. 
Tried it, but will not come back.
author: CJ B.

description: It was. So. Good. Have to get the garlic rice. The bbq pork was amazing. Will have to come back and try the other dishes next time!
author: Hong T.

description: I was attracted to this place by the great variety offered for the party meals. I was very excited to hear this place opened back up 2 weeks ago, and came on the first day it reopened, and this was on a weekend. There were a few other parties, but we were seated immediately. The service was good from beginning to end of the meal. Although it did take a while to get our party for 2 plate serviced on banana leaves, it was worth the wait! The variety of food (which you can see from many pictures) was more than enough for 2 people. I loved the pickled duck eggs, very rare to see these in any Asian restaurants around the bay area. I liked the grilled pork and fish the most. The entire meal is quite healthy as well, with plenty of veggies (okra, eggplant, tomatoes, mango, broccoli). I was stuffed at the end of the meal and didn't feel a bit guilty. I recommended this place to friends and one friend who tried it loved this place as well. I am looking forward to coming back.
author: Alice S.

description: We wanted our asian friends to experience a "boodle fight" and eating with our hands. The place surely did not disappoint us! We ordered the feast that was good for 6, also ordered Kare Kare, sisig, and pansit. Everything was delicious! Highly recommend this place, and we will definitely come back again and again!
author: May D.

description: Place was packed when we went, waited for about 10mins or so. We ordered "Tatluhan" which pretty much have everything, from seafood to pork to veggies. Everything's yummy! We were given sweet yam at the end of our meal, perfect for dessert. The owners are nice and friendly. They only accept cash but fret not, they have atm inside which charges 1.40 dollar per withdrawal.
author: Ses R.

description: I don't think I've ever been somewhere where I was completely unfamiliar with the food and how to eat it that the restaurant staff really took the time to tell me what to get and how to eat each of the items. Our server was SO friendly and truly made us feel comfortable eating food that we'd never eaten before in a style that was unfamiliar. And it was freaking delicious!! We got the sharing platter for two (I can't remember what it was called, but you want it), and he told us how to mix the salad, which sauces to dip in what things, and that Filipinos would eat with their hands, but also gave us forks and spoons if we weren't feeling it. It was such a great experience, really delicious, and so much food. I'll absolutely go back for more. Ahhhhmazing.
author: Laura S.

description:
I brought my parents here for their joint-birthday luncheon. My mom said the food and presentation was spot-on! 

We're a party of 3 and we ordered:
- Dalawahan (a combo platter for 2 guests)
- Miki Bihon (thin and thick noodles)
- Sisig na Bangus (sizzling platter of marinated milk fish)
- 10 orders of Turon (deep fried banana rolls)
- Coffee for all

We loved the various dipping sauces: vinegar, soy/fish, bagoong, and sweet & sour sauce. The serving-size is good and we took home to-go what we couldn't finish. 

The decor is on the casual side. Good enough for a casual first-time date. Overall, services was fast yet pleasant on a Sunday afternoon. They have good teamwork here. Our orders were delivered by different staff. When the food was served, they paused and took time to explain the item. The staff was warm and friendly and ready to strike up a conversation. 

THE CONS:

The only mistake in our order was the Miki Bihon. My dad explained to me this noodle dish should consist of TWO different noodles, thin and thick. Our order had only the thin noodles.

CASH-ONLY IN 2016. Our total order came out to about $80 with a generous tip from dad (yes that's for 3 people). My ego was bruised because it was my parents birthday, and I wanted to treat them out but I didn't have enough cash on hand. My dad quietly slipped me a $50. There's an ATM inside but my frugal mom gave me the no-you-wont-look. Why should I incur bank fees? Besides, I don't think it was working. This cash-only experience gave me a bitter taste. I WOULD NOT recommend this place for a large party that you'll be spending over $200. Who would carry that amount of cash on Mission Street? 

Street-only parking can be a big challenge on this busy intersection on Mission Street. Be prepared to circle around. If you have children or elderly guests, do them a favor and drop them off first. 

I'll give this resto a 4-star (barely). The food was delicious. You just gotta factor in the cons I listed above.
author: Ericson H.

description:
This place was outstanding!  Great food, great service, chilled and laid back atmosphere.

We ordered more than we could handle, they had their house made sauces which were perfect for dipping the various meats.  They had a banana dessert not pictured which we found when paying the bill (excellent!). Definitely will be going back to that little gem.
author: John C.

description:
We didn't try their famous kamayan menu options but what we ordered were DELICIOUS!!!! I don't try to compare Filipino restaurants to my Mom And Pops cooking but this place served up to my expectations.
We ordered kare-kare which was creamy, with moist, tender oxtail ...how it should be...paired with some pink bagoong and life was all of a sudden good again. We also tried the sisig bangus and it was so FRESH...simple ingredients but refreshingly delicious and the sauce it came with was exceptional! Additionally, my friend was curious about the BBQ...we opted for the chicken BBQ and it was well marinated, tender, juicy. Lastly, the lump is Shanghai...I wished it was served first before our actual meal but it came with all the other things we ordered...anywho this place was a great find! Servers were hospitable too AND the place was CLEAN!!!!
Cash only..and they have an ATM machine inside! Enjoy!!!
author: Dee R.

description:
I'm not one to write poor reviews, but I'm going to do so while trying to be as fair as possible. Service was pretty bad, but that was to be expected. Its really the food that torpedoed this rating.

We ordered pork belly, grilled pork, steamed rice, lumpia, and noodles. In theory, these are fairly hard dishes to screw up and yet they were all really terrible. 

Where to begin? First, the noodles were bland and the sauce had 0 flavor. I was worried it would just be sweet, but it was just flavorless and that was the highlight of the menu. Each pork dish tasted like it had been cooked in the morning and just reheated 10 minutes after we had ordered. There was a stale finish with each bite. Furthermore, it was over-salted overcooked, and just awful in every way you could imagine.

The rice was overcooked and cake like. All in all, it was close to some of the worst food I've had in my life.

Also, please don't interpret this as western food snobs showing up to an ethnic restaurant and having a soured experience. This was really cooking 101 failures across the board. Good food shouldn't be prepared 10 hours in advance and then fried to oder. Good rice is good rice no matter what country you come from.

Not much else to say really.
author: Ajit K.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place ever since I moved to the area, and I had the opportunity to finally do so this weekend!

For me, the quality of both the service and food really hits the mark on why I love family-owned establishments. 

First the food. We ordered the kamayan for two people, which really was enough for three (I ate the rest for lunch the next day)! The chicken, tilapia, and pork were packed with flavor and super tender. The feast also came with lumpia and salted egg (quite salty prepare yourself!). Eggplants, okra, and broccoli balanced out the meaty items, and the mango and tomato salsa rounded out the meal with a refreshing tanginess.

Last but certainly not the least, the service was impeccable. Long story short we had a hiccup with the check (it was our fault), but the owner handled it in a way I am truly grateful for. I highly recommend coming here. You seriously will not regret it if you enjoy authentic, family-style filipino cuisine!

(REMINDER: IT'S CASH ONLY. DON'T FORGET.)
author: Derick N.

description:
6 of us shared the kamayan and ordered 3 total halo halos. Came out to about $20 per person. It was great! 

-Service is so friendly
-Street parking
-you can use your hands but there are utensils if you really wish
-their non kamayan dishes smelled so flavorful too !
author: Veranna N.

description: IF I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE ZERO STARS I WOULD. I arrived an hour before they close their restaurant and they turned me away saying that their kitchen was closed. Like ???
author: Tabitha R.

description:
We had just come home from a flight from Vegas and we were hungry!! Like every time we go out for food, we are starving!! Ahaha 

We have always wanted to try out a Filipino Restaurant that has kamayan  (eat with your hands) This place is so close to us so we gave it a shot.

We get there and the restaurant to full! First good sign! The waiter was very friendly.  He sat us down fairly quick but also accomodated us when we wanted a bigger table when it became available.  

We ordered "dalawahan" (for 2) which comes with Lumpia, bbq chicken, pork, whole fried tilapia, steamed eggplant, okra, broccoli, salted eggs with tomatoes, onion, and mango and a mound full of rice.  Dipping sauces: sweet chili for the lumpia, shrimp paste, and vinegar.  Everything was delicious!!!

We had coconut juice from a coconut which was nice because after the juice was done, we scooped out the coconut pulp for dessert!  

Just when we thought we were done, they bring out sweet yams for dessert. 

Come to find out, the workers were the owners! They provided excellent service!! We will be back!!!
author: Candice V.

description:
First time at this place with my BF. Had a dinner date here after playing "tourists" in the city. The location is pretty good, but good luck on finding a spot; it's the "mission district". We just happen to be lucky; getting a parking space right in front of it, on a Friday night. The server was very friendly and attentive. Took our order and food was served to us in a timely manner. 
We ordered "Dalawahan" and there was so much food on the platter, my man & I did not expect it to be that much. The platter had a variety of items. And it was fun to eat with your "kamay", but we totally enjoyed the food; especially how it was plated and presented. 

I am only rating this restaurant 4 stars because of the fish. The tilapia wasn't cooked all the way, the fish meat was still a 'lil raw inside. It wasn't seasoned as well. I guess we could've told the server, but we didn't. It was a small issue and not a big deal.

I will definitely come back to try more items on the menu. And I will definitely ask them to cook our food the way it's supposed to be cooked.
author: Veronica D.

description:
My family ordered the Animan menu for our kamayan dinner. Food was alright, just typical Filipino fare. We thought the entire table was going to be covered with banana leaves and food placed in the center. Instead, they bring it out on banana covered platters and give you bamboo plate holders covered in banana leaves. 

The customer service was great. Everyone was very friendly and always smiling. Call ahead to reserve tables if you're coming with a big party. Check in with Yelp & they won't charge you for extra rice.
author: Mar H.

description:
Seriously, Ate Josie and Kuya are the BEST! 

I can't even begin to say enough good things about this place. The kitchen is clean (unlike "other" Kamayan places), the service is amazing (unlike "other" kamayan places), and the food is so delicious! 

I love how they always have TFC on, how there's a karaoke machine just in case people want to sing, and that their children are usually at the restaurant studying. It makes me feel like I'm walking into their home. And you know Ate Josie, cooks like she is at home. She also loves to walk out and make sure everyone is doing well. 

I continue to come here because they always remember who I am and they always treat me like family. They feed me like family too! haha.
author: Rylan C.

description: We love coming here even if parking is a challenge. We ordered the "Kamayan" for 4; there were 5 of us so we added an order of pork sinigang.  The tray comes with steamed broccoli, eggplant and okra; grilled tilapia, squid, chicken BBQ, fried shrimp, shanghai, grilled pork, and salted eggs with diced tomatoes and mango and comes with various type of dipping sauce ( shrimp paste, white vinegar, sweet and sour sauce and hot sauce) all that for less than $50. It was actually enough for the 5 of us.  The owners are very friendly. Anyway, I believe the kamayan meal also comes with sweet potatoes for dessert; but the owner gave us a choice of sweet potatoes or turon! Of course we chose turon so they gave us 5 pieces.  It was so good...so  light and crispy  and they are huge!  I'm a fan!!  P.s.  Sign shows Cash only, but they do accept credit cards.
author: Elle A.

description: This place is great! It's just a few blocks from where I live, yet I felt like I was in the Philippines. We got a platter for three with a huge variety of delicious foods on it including barbecued chicken, grilled pork, steamed rice, fried shrimp, steamed fresh vegetables, homemade dipping sauces and a Filipino salad made of chopped tomatoes, chopped mango and hard-boiled egg. I realize it may sound strange, but it was delicious! The owner was amazingly friendly, and he taught us the traditional ways to eat Filipino food. A really fun experience.
author: Ethan C.

description:
I didn't grow up with a big ass wooden spoon and fork on my wall.

I never turned around when someone said, "Psssst!" or "Hoy!".

And I sure as hell can't sing for sh*t.

Thank goodness I can blame my unFilipinoness on being just a quarter. 

Considering that I didn't even know how to pronounce sisig until two years ago, I'm still learning about Filipino cuisine. It was just recently that I heard about Kamayan dinners. A meal that's made for parties of 2, 4, 6 or more with a banana leaf that's piled with mounds of food to be eaten with your hands.

Pampanguena Cuisine offers Kamayan dinners in addition to your typical Filipino fare of BBQ, silogs, and turo turo style of cuisine where you make your own combo plate by pointing at what you like from the hot trays. They also provide catering and is a good option if you need to bring something for a potluck (a tray of lumpia or turon is always a good potluck item). NO MSG is used as I called ahead to make sure if it. CC's accepted. 

The staff at Pampanguena Cuisine is very friendly and welcoming so you feel like you're eating a Filipino family's house. It's a bit of an hole-in-the-wall that seats about 25 people with TFC blasting in the background. Not exactly a place to impress a date unless you wanna go home with blue balls.

The Kamayan dinner is the way to go at Pampanguena Cuisine as you can have a tropical buffet for just $13 a person. It's even cheaper if you go in a larger group as the Kamayan dinner for 10 is less than $100.

Our Kamayan dinner for two ($26.95) came with bbq beef, bbq pork with a black pepper sauce (like a Chinese cha siu), a whole grilled tilapia, lumpia shanghai, fried eggplant, steamed broccoli & okra, two hardboiled duck eggs, two heaping mounds of steamed rice and accouterments of diced mangos, tomatoes and raw onions: http://bit.ly/YQwFbm. Several dipping sauces of vinegar, sweet chili sauce, calamansi, and bagoong (shrimp paste) was provided for your dipping pleasure. The meats provided were different than what was listed on the menu (I was hoping for lechon) but this was because they ran out of the meats listed so make sure to come early.

The bbq beef was tender and smoky, the bbq pork was plump with a peppery sweetness and the tilapia moist and flaky. You can never go wrong with the fried deliciousness of lumpia shanghai. Make sure to eat each spoonful of grub with the mangos, tomatoes and onion to get a pop of tangy tart sweetness. Nothing mind-blowing but the Kamayan dinner IS solid eats that will deliciously fill your tummy without breaking the bank.

I use to cringe at my dad when he would eat with a spoon and a fork. It looked so unrefined but here I was shoveling the food into my mouth with a fork AND a spoon to get maximum grubage per a bite. Total savage status. 

TFC's popular show of "It's Showtime" was playing the entire time we were eating dinner at Pampanguena Cuisine. For 60 minutes, we listened to Filipinas soulfully singing hits from Taylor Swift, Demi Lovato, and Rihanna.

Mr. NSS: "You're part Filipino so I bet you CAN sing...when are going to sing for me?"

Me: "When you wanna go deaf, dear."

*Hating my parents for never investing in a karaoke machine*
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Really good and the kids liked it especially the bbq and fish. We ordered the dalawan, it's good for sharing.
author: M C.

description: Walked in with a smile, walked out with a smile and a full belly! What can we say that others haven't already? This gem of a restaurant is a winner when it comes to tasty Filipino food! Chef Michael was very pleasant on the phone to answer some questions before we came in, and he, along with Josie were very excellent hosts, making us feel right at home! We will most definitely come back! The wifey and I shared the dalawahan which is loaded with goodness! Do yourself a favor and stop reading reviews, get in your car, and pay them a visit!
author: Andres D.

description: The service is EXCELLENT. My friends and I got the kamayan for 4 (eating with your hands) The waiter explained which elements went best with each other and described how pampangans normally ate each item, but always said that it was completely up to us how to eat it! I appreciated the information and he was just so attentive. This is where I will introduce all my non Filipino friends to when then want to experience kamayan!
author: Kayla K.

description:
I had the following during my recent visit: 

Sinigang na Baka
Kaldaretang Baka
Barbeque Chicken
Pritong Isda (Bangus/milkfish)
Garlic Rice
Lumpiang Gulay

Overall, I thought the food here was very good.  The Sinigang (tamarind-based soup) had the perfect amount of tartness to the dish along with tender pieces of beef and good vegetables.  The Kaldareta (tomato-based stew with beef) was also good - the beef was tender and the stew had a nice balance of sweet/sour...the vegetables were a bit on the "crisp" side, but still good.  The skewers of BBQ chicken were great - tender pieces of BBQ chicken with a sweet and tangy marinade and sauce...there was actually a great portion of chicken on each skewer.  The fried milkfish was perfectly fried with a nice tender and rich belly in the center for people to indulge in.  The garlic rice was great - the perfect amount of garlic and a nice texture to the rice.  The vegetable lumpia was also good with a nice rice paper and loads of vegetables in thick pieces of lumpia.  All the beef items arrived with the bones attached to the meat, which I know adds flavor to the dish, but is a bit annoying when trying to eat.

This place is very casual and has an extensive menu...they also have kamayan options (traditional Filipino dining with your hands) for groups of 2,3,4, and 6.  Keep in mind: CASH ONLY!
author: Ken G.

description:
The food was fantastic and the portions were generous, but what really impressed me was the level of service. I've never met an owner so friendly and welcoming. He took his time to explain everything and always had a smile on his face.

Great place! Will definitely visit again.
author: Caroline P.

description:
I made a reservation for 3 on a Saturday night at 6pm.. luckily I didn't need it.  

Here's the skinny on our eats:
+ kamayan for 3 - photo - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pampanguena-cuisine-san-francisco#PmiEYaXFFUkV1er4aGartg).  
** came with grilled squid, chicken, beef, shrimp, tilapia, mango and tomato salsa, salty eggs, okra, broccoli and lumpia of course!  The chicken and lumpia were my faves.  
+ halo halo - photo - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pampanguena-cuisine-san-francisco#MnX8603l17AmbkwwwHA1gg
** FTW!~ It's the best I've ever had - not that I've had much, but hey!  I've had my fair share. They use jack fruit ice cream instead of ube which is actually WAY better.  The portion is perfect for 3 to share.  They don't skimp out on all the goodies too (red beans, coconut, etc).

I was excited to have a 'home cooked' meal with my dad and introduce my man to some good eats of my peeps ~ sadly nothing in the meal itself stood out for me.  The halo halo though - man that's some real good stuff!

The family is very sweet and the service was great!  Also, the area is a bit sketchy so I don't recommend going alone, esp at night.
author: Beverly E.

description: I ordered a large amount of food for 50 people and they catered our party. The food was VERY good and authentic. We fed many people who had never had Filipino food. The price is good too. Joycie the owner has great customer service and made everything god smooth. This is the place to go for great food.
author: Crystal M.

description:
+
Solid Filipino cuisine
Generous portions for kamayan 
Friendly and attentive staff 

-
CA$H ONLY!!!
author: Miss G.

description:
Food: 5/5
Price: $
Portion: 5/5
Service: 4/5
Appearance: 3.5/5
Presentation of food: 4.5/5
OVERALL: 5/5

Came by the other day with my husband, he had eaten their food before (and I have tried off of him from his leftover doggy bag), it is really good! So I decided to make a trip here with him and see whats this place is about!

I'm just so sad that no one knows about this place! They deserve much more credit for their food!

- Bbq Chicken skewers
- White rice
- Lumpia Shanghai

The bbq chicken is so tasty! It has a settle char 'bbq' taste, with a sweet kick of their bbq sauce. Chicken is moist and easy to eat (not tough at all!). Generous portion!
I'm a rice type of girl and their white rice was the perfect pair to the chicken, it cuts through the flavors and the texture is soft and fluffy!
Lumpia is crispy, hot off the fryer, the pork and veggie inside is warm and perfectly seasoned! Comes in a order of 25 pieces, for a price of $6.50!!! Comon can't beat that.

If you are in need of a filippino food fix or just want to try something different in the area than the usual burritos, tacos, sushi, come to Pampanguena!

P.S.
The owners are so sweet and friendly! Very attentive too made sure we had everything we need and that our waters were filled.
author: Eva H.

description: Love the kamayan dinner! Excellent customer service. Delicious food and super clean resturant. Will definitely come with the family more often.
author: Megan C.

description:
Let me say this: it's hard to find good Filipino food within the bounds of San Francisco. For the number of Filipinos here, it's a travesty. Without getting into the centuries of sociocultural baggage that has led to this eventuality, I will just say that I am extremely happy to have found Pampanguena Cuisine. 

Coming from a Kapampangan (sorry Dad) family, I spent all of my childhood summers in Pampanga, eating Kapampangan food. Frankly, anyone that says that any other Filipino region's cuisine is better, doesn't know what they're talking about. And boy does Pampanguena Cuisine deliver.

Prompted by an intense craving for simple, down home, Filipino food, I came here and decided to chow down on the Kamayan for 2. SO MUCH FOOD and SO GOOD. It hit all the right spots. Grilled tilapia, check. Grilled pork (with their tangy, sweet house teriyaki sauce), check. Barbecue chicken, check. Served with various sides of okra, eggplant, tomato, salted duck egg, mango, broccoli (ok not so traditional), and of course, generous mounds of rice, all on a glorious banana leaf lined boat, it was impressive in its immensity. (FYI, the kamayan doesn't come with grilled calamari until after 3pm). Eating off woven rattan plates lined with banana leaf reminded me of the fiestas of my childhood. Knocking it all down with a zesty, sweet calamansi juice was just the right kind of Filipino comfort that I needed. 

Sure the decor is a little island kitchy and the 80's/90's soft rock/Celine Dion music is confusing when overlaid over the TFC showing in the corner TV but even that made it feel all the more authentically Filipino. Really felt like I was back home eating at my grandma's house in Pampanga. What could be higher praise than that?

All of that would have earned this place five stars except for the fact that their posted hours on Yelp say they're open until 9. Word to the wise, come before 8 since there's a healthy chance that they'll be closed by 8:30 (which they were when I first tried to eat here).
author: Mark D.

description: Ignore 5 stars; never ate here and just wanted to provide the following update. Currently closed 3/3-3/27 due to family funeral in the Philippines.
author: Allison Y.

description:
Close to our house!! Terrible street parking cuz on Mission!!

But the food is good.Reasonable prices for food.Love the lumpia shanghai is tastier than Nick's Kitchen to us.Had my hubby's work tested out which is better. They also have Vegetable Lumpia for vegetarians! I like my Beef&Vegetable anyway,lol! More too come...
author: Myra O.

description: Less 1 star for location/restroom. The owner admitted that they do need a better location. I hope they find one soon. The food, bang for buck, and service is excellent. The best Kamayan in the bay~
author: Suzette R.

description: Came here on Valentine's Day with my boyfriend after hours of searching for a place to eat since my go to Filipino food place was closed. Boy am I glad that we came here because for the price that we paid and the amount of flavorful food we received made my day. The owner himself hosted and served our food, he is a very sweet man and went about and beyond with his service. The food was served in a prompt manner which made me really happy because I was starving. the meal was served in a large bamboo basket type thing and it was enough to feed my boyfriend and I and leaving us left overs to take home. I am looking forward to coming back to this place and trying everything else they have.
author: Brenda H.

description: This place wasnt only yummy, but the waiters and the owner were so friendly!!! Came here on a sunday with my family and we really enjoyed the place. They even let my mom sing karaoke! Haha definitely get their lechon Kawali and turon!! The only problem is that they dont have a parking lot so you have to find street parking and street parking is pretty difficult to find there. :(
author: John R.

description: Super friendly, family run, authentic Filipino lumpia! I haven't found delicious Shanghai lumpia like this in SoCal! Kudos to the extraordinary accommodating owners.  I was in a real pinch to have a phone order fulfilled for a party platter of lumpia for the holidays and the owner made a one-time exception!  There were so many delicious lumpias that went home with many guests! Will definitely be coming back for more exquisite food and notably wonderful, hospitable service!
author: William H.

description: Finally, a great Filipino restaurant close in my neighborhood! Tried it for the first time yesterday. Ordered the pancit bison, lumpias, and bbq chicken and bbq pork. Got it to go. The food was delicious! The lady that worked there was really nice and sweet. Next time, I will take my whole family to eat there because I want to eat with all the food laid out on the green leaves. Will definitely go back again. Unfortunately, it is CASH ONLY. There was an ATM there but it was out of order. All in all, it was great! Open to try new dishes from the menu next time.
author: Diana T.

description:
We were in SF area and decided to get Pinoy food. So we started looking for the nearest Filipino restaurant with the highest rating on Yelp...and Pampanguena Cuisine was there on the top 5....so, off we went. 

There was only 1 table occupied when we came in around 12 noon and seems like they're still waiting to get their orders as their table are empty...no water, no utensils, no plates etc. - can't tell if they were there for a while or they've just been seated when we arrived. 

We're hearing some loud discussions behind the counter about problems on the internet connection, 15 minutes later and still waiting. 

Around 20 minutes or so, a lady came to the other table and took their orders and then she went to our table and asked if we're ready - told her we've just helped ourselves getting the menu books from the front desk and no, we're not yet ready and off she went
.
After 15 minutes, we are now ready to order but there's no waiter in sight, 10 more minutes and still nothing. So, I decided to go to the counter and told a guy there that we are ready to order, and he said he'll be on the table in a few....Okidokie...

We ordered the 4 person platter (though we're just 3), priced for $48. My companions ordered a side dish of pancit Canton and Pinakbet.

I thought the order will take a while as they will still fire up the grill for the Tilapia and the Squid but after about 20 to 25 minutes, our order came...not bad huh?

Oh yeah, it was bad...you can tell the fish was at least a day old, probably leftover from yesterday - dried and discolored...meat was stale and yellowish, not white which was supposed to be the color of a freshly grilled though previously frozen Tilapia - I should know, I'm a weekend grillmaster and yes, I sometimes eat leftover grilled fish from a day or two ago and that's why I know a duck when I see one. The squid was also very very dry, it's either overcooked or leftover too from yesterday's... 

all in all, food was ordinary...even the freshly cooked ones i.e. lumpia, deep fried prawns, bbq were just ordinary, nothing to sing praises and hallelujahs about.

If they would have just served freshly cooked ones on our order (well, they should do it on every order all the time), then I'll probably rate them 3.0 stars. 

I just can't understand why on earth would a highly "yelp rated" restaurant like them will serve a day old dish (or maybe 2 days? or 3? who knows, I can't tell the difference) just to save few dollars? Do they really really think their customers can't tell the difference? Is the $3 or let's say $5 money they've saved on that old poor Tilapia worth the 1 star rating I gave them? 

Hell no....my companion actually posted the picture of the platter before we dug in and 3 friends already posted comments even before we're done eating, asking if they're good and yes...your guess is as good as mine...wasted time and money...

All in all, we've paid $83 inc. tax and we left the waiter $10 tip...... for the LAST TIME.
 
Lesson Learned...

For us: we're always skeptic on Yelp reviews...it's always a hit and miss thing....and missed things are getting more and more frequent...so, we'll probably just go with our family's and friends' suggestions...but they're a hit and miss thing too...lol

For the owners: Please, you're really not doing yourselves a favor (profit wise) if you serve leftover dishes from yesterday's or 2 days ago or 3...you're just shooting yourselves in the foot. You already have high ratings on YELP...the only thing you need to do is to keep on doing what got you the high ratings and that is...SERVE GOOD FRESHLY COOKED FOOD.


and what happened to that poor OLD Tilapia?.....no worries, it will still be of use...it will be mixed to an Ilocano dish... yes, Diningding, that's what's for dinner....my Dad's favorite dish...
author: Joselito A.

description:
this place is drive all the way across town crave worthy fantastic - I make my girlfriend drive me here every other week at least. super authentic family owned Filipino.

the sinigang na baboy (tamarind soup with pork) is my favorite I've had anywhere and keeps bringing me back. perfectly sour broth and falling apart meat. a single order is more than enough food for me and my gf for a meal - really generous portions. 
chicken adobo is good but not as good as others I've had.
bangsilog (fried milkfish with rice and egg) has the fish fried to perfection.

service is sometimes slow - but they're so freaking sweet I don't mind at all.
author: Rachel M.

description: The restaurant staff seated us even though we came in a little after closing time. We had the set meal for 6 and added "ni laga" for the cold weather. The food came out fairly quickly and was presented beautifully on a woven platter and banana leaves. The lumpia was crunchy and the sweet and sour sauce was just right. The vegetables were grilled which complimented with the rest of the flavorful meat and seafood. Definitely a place I would like to go back to and try the rest of the menu.
author: David L.

description: 1st timer here.. What can say? BEST FOOD and BEST SERVICE. Will definitely recommend to everyone.. Happy tummy
author: Charlie b.

description:
This spot is so damn good. Bring me back to when I was in the Philippines eating Kamayan every other day. 
The quantity is huge. The quality is top notch and the selections are perfect. Their 6person setup is my favorite. Great service but parking sucks in the area. We will be back for sure. I highly recommend them to family and friends. A Gem for SF
author: Mckevin F.

description:
Ordered take out for the first time here , I wanted to try everything . They were very polite and welcoming when we came to pick up the food . 
Coming from family that can cook some great home cooked Filipino food I have my opinion . 
I wish I could rate this place on their  dishes because some deserve 5 stars 

Kare Kare- little to watery I like my sauce thicker but the oxtail was generous 
Shanghai lumpia- I prefer a meaty lumpia this tasted more like a shrunken egg roll lots of veggies little meat 
Sisig- now this was delicious and not very spicy  
BBQ Skewers- delicious , generous amount of chicken and flavored wonderfully at an amazing $2.50each wow   

Chicken adobo- I wanted pork because we all know that's bomb and no broken bones in that traditional adobo . The flavor here was good and I actually ate This the next day with a fried egg and I loved it more . 

Garlic rice - save your money, put your rice in your rice cooker and just add some garlic cloves . 
I thought it would be a garlic fried rice . A bit disappointed
author: S R.

description: I remember that the food stretched down the entire table and I was too full to move after the meal LOL We came close to closing and was fortunate enough to be seated without reservations. As per a friend's suggestion and advice, we have to eat everything family style and with our hands. This was my first time eating a legit Filipino meal and the experience blown me away. In my opinion, the meats were too salty for my liking, but I enjoyed the lumpias, eggplant, okra and mangoes. The boiled eggs seems to be salted was not my favorite. The price came out to about $20 per person. Overall, I enjoyed the experience and I would come back with a group for the dining experience.
author: Sally Z.

description:
We just ate here for the first time last weekend with my family.... They say first impression last right? so we can say, there's negative & positive ones.

PROS

Regarding the food, we can't say bad coz it's good especially their inihaw. We just had their KAMAYAN for 6 people and ordered 2 for 13 person, and it's astounding, we still have to take out some of it. 

The price range is I think not bad coz you're eating a nice and tasty meal, truly a home cook meal. We love it! 

The ambiance, nice! If you're inside, It's just like entering into a bahay kubo
type of place. You're not thinking that you're in a different country.



CONS

First, this is a "CASH ONLY" restaurant... Not Good! They have ATM inside but as we know it, withdrawing money from a public ATMs means additional bank fees for us, so better bring a lot of CASH when you eat here... who brings a lot of cash nowadyas? too risky right?  Ofcourse they have a sign on the door that says.. "CASH ONLY" but the fact that you have to find your banks ATMs nearby if you don't want to pay some bank fees makes you a bit pissed of especially if you're that hungry, right? or else better just pay an additional bank fees. smh

The parking is on the side street only, If it's busy, you'll have to find some parking space which maybe a bit far from the restaurant. And remember, don't count the fact that you'll again paying for the parking space right? maybe $2.00 minimum an hour... smh... Ofcourse this is given to the fact that it's San Francisco area, but I just want to tell for others especially the ones that are not from around here, just want to taste their home cook meals. So just better be ready.

For their drinks, I think it's a bit pricey especially the "Buko" which you can't eat the inside of it coz the hole is a bit small, they should open it up big enough for the spoon to get in. We know that aside from it's juice, the inside is the best to eat.... better just stay with water.

The place is a bit jammed up too.... so, If you're a bit bigger, need to say excuse me to get to where you want to.... You know what I mean!


In conclusion, we had a good time here, going out full but the mere fact that we have some issues especially the CASH ONLY basis and the SIDE STREET PARKING FEES is just a 3.5 star for me and the rest of my family. Maybe this is not the eating place that you will keep coming back over & over, once in a while I think.
author: Lou H.

description: This is the first Filipino restaurant I have been to. As someone who is hispanic I am very unfamiliar with what to order and the staff was EXTREMELY helpful. The food was presentable and was flavorful. I was very impressed with everything.
author: Rebecca M.

description: I was really excited to try this place but it fell flat for me. The food was decent but not amazing (definitely not 4.5 stars worthy) The food came out cold, except the sisig platter which was the highlight of the meal. We ordered the huge shared platter for 6, and though it looks like a lot of food, it's mostly filler items like bland steamed vegetables and way too much rice. If you come here don't get the shared platter and just go with the pork sisig and maybe some garlic rice.
author: Derrick W.

description:
THIS PLACE IS OVER RATED.

I am giving this place a 1-star rating for the following reasons:
1. The food was not amazing at all except for the "DINUGUAN." 

2. The "BARBEQUED SQUID" was tasteless. No flavor at all. Dry.

3. The "LECHON KAWALI" was a disappointment. It was old. Cooked days before. Akin to an order of another costumer that was a left-over days before; washed up; re-fried. Et voila! It was served to me and to my spouse!  Seeing it on our table was a shock to us. It was insulting, in fact. 

As you must know, when the "LECHON KAWALI" Is freshly fried (or baked), its meat and skin should be crunchy; the fat- juicy, and overall color should be golden brown. Here, THE SKIN WAS NOT CRUNCHY BUT RUBBERY! The meat is dry and too dark. It was also served WARM, not hot.  It was a struggle eating it like me having to deal with TUG-O-WAR between my teeth and the F_ _ _ING PORK! Husband and I just tried one each and dang, that was it. 

4. I had expected a better food service from this place considering the fact that it has received a lot of 5-star ratings from its patrons. And for crying out loud, they even had a spread at the SFO Chronicle!!! Also, it is costly. Not worth it.

5. Lastly, my  husband had expected an "AUTHENTIC LECHON KAWALI" as it is traditionally done (served as a whole chunk of pork and then, sliced into bite size when served. *SEE PHOTOS BELOW*). RE: the sauce- it is a joke. Too much gelatin. I didn't even recognize the liver flavor. it had a funny taste. Well, what do I say? It was a case of a recycled old LECHON! That's it. Honestly,  I sensed that the woman and the man who served us this were watching us all thru the time we were there; thinking probably that they got rid of their old forgotten LECHON to good use. Ha! Yes, we were screwed and we just decided to be  mum during the time we were there, dealing with this frustration and ordeal. But, hello- it is about time you folks know if it's worth coming here  at all (and dump your hard earned dough?). It's your call. Merci beaucoup!
author: E Olga P.

description: Thank you again Yelp for helping me find this gem! This is the first time my family and I have experienced "kamayan" style of eating Filipino food and this was really good! We did the Animan which feeds 6 people and the Tatluhan that feeds 3 people and definitely fed all of my family and still have left overs. Btw, there was 15 of us, half were kids and other half adults. Food quality is awesome because it's mostly grilled, not that oily and super fresh.  I would definitely bring friends and family over here when I'd come back to south sf.
author: Jocelyn Z.

description: The serving is huge! The food is even better. We stayed longer after lunch and the servers are still accomodating to us and asked us if we need any more water or something.we had take outs. They forgot to change the bangus in animan meal and forgot the garlic rice but theyre very apologitic about it and didnt even charge us the upgrade meal and 15% tip we were groul of 8 i asked why they said because they felt they had bad service, which i didnt think so! I will come back definitely if im in the area! Great service, great food!
author: Jufi C.

description: The bilao is worth the price! We got the 4person bilao and the meats are so good!! i will come back here when i go to San Fran! Ate is so nice to give us free extra rice and free dessert, minatamis na kamote(yams). Ate we will come back there ha!!! Free rice again hehehe
author: Rochelle R.

description: We came to Daly city to get some Filipino food and we could not have chosen a better place. I got the fish sisig and it was delicious. My partner got kare kare and it was very good. Only thought was the restaurant could have been warmer; it was a little chilly.
author: Laura J.

description: Celebrated my daughter's 1st Birthday here September 20, 2015. Food is awesome, everyone on the party enjoyed everything that is served. Thank you to the owner Tita Jo, for being so accommodating and preparing a delicious buffet.
author: Estel A.

description: Born, raised, and having lived in the Philippines for most of my life (23 years!), I could def say this is one of the more authentic Filipino restaurants in SF. I've been here over 3x and was impressed each time, especially with their boodle fight. I don't think there is any other place you can get a boodle fight on actual banana leaves! Definitely takes me back to my roots. I even am compelled to eat with my hands every time. ;) Their sisig is good as well, served on a hot sizzling plate with lots of onions - perhaps the closest you could get to authentic sisig from Manila. Had to leave out one star for service, however. Last time I went (Sunday at around 1PM), the wait was HORRIBLE. Had to wait ~20 mins to be seated and then another ~45-50 mins to be served food. I was hungry and irritable and it really ruined the experience... they also seemed to be all over the place that time, not cleaning up tables fast enough to free up more space for new customers, forgetting some things we asked for (like lemons for our sisig), etc. Would highly suggest that they hire at least 2 more waiters/waitresses to accommodate their customer flow! Other than that though, this place is really good, and I for sure will be back. Just hoping service is better next time!
author: Trisha D.

description:
Auntie was very cute and helpful even towards my nonfilipino friend!
Food was amazing! And really good for the buck! 
Leche plan for desert was so good and had left overs for another night! 
Will be coming back with more friends! Great place to introduce them to Filipino food!
author: Paul C.

description:
28-September, Saturday
We ordered the Dalawahan special, which serves 2 and is beautifully presented on a giant platter & banana leaves. Not having had the taste of Filipino-fare before I wanted my friend to be able to graze on everything without having to commit to merely a single thing that he risked not enjoying.

-chicken barbecue: that was tastefully seasoned, flavored, and cooked.
-grilled tilapia: a bit smokey, fresh and flaky.
-inihaw na baboy (grilled pork chops): similar to how my grandma makes it, deliciously marinated, char-grilled, and served as little cuttings that were about 1/2" thick.
-itlog na maalat (salted duck egg)
-lumpiang shanghai
-mango / onion / tomato 
-minatamis na kamote (sweet potatoes): with rich syrup 
-steamed rice
-steamed seasonal vegetables
-talong (eggplant)

The service is super friendly, the food is well within good value..
And the atmosphere more of a hole-in-the-wall yet very inviting.
author: Ty T.

description: Drove took Bart and walked for over an hour to try this place out and it didn't disappoint .We wanted a home cooked meal on our trip to SF somewhere we thought the fam would like. Well it was worth the trek everyone enjoyed it.
author: Andrew J.

description:
Their Kamayan is delicious!!! Soo much food for such a cheap price. Plus the service is great! Jozie and Lan the owners are really sweet, they love giving great service. They also do Filipino catering for large events! Check them out! 

You have to get their turon and bbq (the best in town)!!!
author: Abbey S.

description: Yep, this place is good. I'm half Filipino, have been to the Philippines, grew up eating Filipino food for years at family gatherings, and took my mom to this joint when she was visiting SF a few months ago......needless to say we know a thing or two about this kind of food. We approve. Gonna keep it short and sweet and say you can't go wrong with anything on the menu (we ordered like 7 things). And trust me, I would say something if I thought the food sucked (see my other reviews for other Asian restaurants).
author: Lyle Z.

description: Amazing food , excellent services and great atmosphere. It is a must go place. We got the plate for two and we almost couldn't finish.
author: Albert M.

description: Omg! This place got some good Filipino food. The food for 6 is really enough for 10. They give u lots of food. Great environment.
author: P M.

description:
The food was great. We ordered the combo for two to share and still had some to pack home. 

The reason I gave 3 stars instead of 4 is: as the waiter introduced the sauces to us, he kept robbing his nose, then used the same hand to touch the saucer. It was like this back and forth for 4 of each sauce he introduced to us. Don't get me wrong, the food was great. In terms of being hygienic, there is room for improvement.
author: Yc C.

description:
Great place! Ok I'm biased because my blood is from Pampanga but the food speaks for itself! People are friendly and the presentation is beautiful! Prices are great too! 
Came here with my co-workers and loved it!
author: Marie P.

description: The meal for two was awesome, lots of variety and great sauces. At least four entrees, vegetables, and mango tomato side. Presentation was very tropical, fun time trying to eat all of it. Prices were very reasonable, wait staff very nice. Will definitely go back and recommend this place.
author: Maria M.

description: Dont even think about this restaurant! Awful restaurant!  The price is not comparable to the quality of food! I would never go again to this palce for any reason and I dont recommend this resturant, not even to my worst eneym! In few words, you should better try McDonals on the main road! I gave all my food to homeless guy on the street!
author: Amir P.

description:
It was our 1st time- good food, place is clean!

We ordered the kamayan for 6- it was very delicious.  Staff are very helpful & friendly, I'll be coming back!!
author: Cristina B.

description:
This restaurant should really be called -- JUST LIKE MY GRANDPARENT'S KITCHEN

That is all.

*drops mic*

*walks away*

PS: The sinagang na baboy will rock your freakin' world AND The Filipino Channel is on 24/7.
author: Bruce R.

description:
My friend and I had lunch here a few days ago after months of talking about walking around her neighborhood and exploring.  This place is totally unassuming,  It blends in to the rest of the block and would not have been noticed had we not been carefully checking out all the storefronts we passed.  When we made it in, we were greeted by a very friendly young woman.  We were each provided a glass of cold water with a slice of calamansi, a nice surprise treat!

While trying to decide, we noticed that they have a few items on the board listed as their lunch special.  We decided to share their 2 dish combo of dinuguan and chicken barbeque.  What we got was a ginormous skewer of full flavored chicken yumminess, a generous soup bowl's worth of some of the best pork stew I can remember having and a scoop of rice, all for under $9.  We also ordered pansit canton because I felt the need to pretend that I am eating a balanced meal including some vegetables, however miniscule they may be.  Who knew this dish would turn out to be so delightful also??

Everything we had had just the right amount of salt, which is usually a pet peeve of mine.  Customer service was awesome.  Prices per item were more than fair.  What's not to love here?!!
author: Yvette F.

description:
I love small family-run places like this. You can taste their labor of love in their food. Mom cooks daily, dad and kids runs the the tables efficiently with a lovely pinoy-friendliness. 

Laing is wow!
Pansit bihon- my fave! Theirs is nice and the noodles are soft like luglog :)
Inihaw na pusit.
Bangus sisig - super MUST try!
Halo-halo (fresh sweet kamote)
author: K O.

description: Great authentic home style Filipino food. It's a must try for all you Filipinos and Filipino food lovers. Excellent service and hospitality! I went around 330pm on Sunday so there was plenty of parking.
author: Russell A.

description: Great food and service. Food is delicious and affordable. Highly recommend the 'kamayan' option and halo-halo for dessert.
author: Alliv S.

description: Tried this place out last week and I really enjoyed their food. I searched all high and low to find a place that sells good lumpia and this place would be my top 3. I also got a tocilog and longsilog dishes. The tocilog is my favorite, very flavorful and the garlic rice wasn't too overpowering like other places. Just the right amount of food too. I would def go back whenever I'm craving this again.
author: Lisa K.

description: Had the Pancit Bihon for lunch.  It's rice noodles with veggies and chicken.  A little oily but really tasty.  I couldn't finish.  Very basic space and service was slow, though I got my food pretty fast.  Next table had a sizzling pork plate which looked good.  Got out for $12 with tip, I'll be back!
author: Steven S.

description: This place has really good pinoy food, my fiance and I stop by one day while looking for philipino food and we loved it. The staff was super friendly. Great place to get authentic philipino food
author: Juan C.

description: The staff was SO friendly and accommodating for our large party of 17! The food was DELICIOUS, everyone was stuffed and there was still food left over, there was amazing music and karoake, everyone had a great time, and the price for each person was very affordable. I would definitely recommend this place, especially for the friendly staff and fun atmosphere!
author: Kenny Y.

description: If you're looking for delicious, authentic Filipino food...this is definitely the place to go. I'm kapampangan and can vouch for the place being legit, unlike some other filipino restaurants in the Bay Area. In addition to the great food, the service was excellent! We were a party of 12 and the owners were so friendly and super hospitable...almost felt like I was back home at some Filipino party. I would highly recommend this place! I'll be back soon Pampamguena Cuisine!! Thanks for making my birthday celebration such an awesome one!
author: Charlene F.

description:
We arrived at this restaurant's location in Excelsior and it was empty. Not usually a good sign but we were hungry and intent on eating here based on the Yelp reviews. 

The owner Josie convinced us to get the kamayan for two, and glad we did! It's meant to be eaten with your hands and we did. Very fun! It included bbq chicken, beef tapa I think, whole tilapia, lumpia, eggplant, mango salad, and the best bagoong ever (sharimp paste). Oh and salted egg? I think.. i don't usually like those, but these were very good. Everything was ooo yummy, tasted really good. The meats were good quality. And it was an event, so we had a real good time. We'll have to come back and try other items on the menu.
author: Vol T.

description: Pampanguena catered for an event I hosted last night and did not disappoint. We had the pancit palabok, garlic fried rice, chicken adobo, pork BBQ, chopsuey, and lumpia. My favorite was the pancit palabok and the BBQ pork. If you're looking for some good eats or a place to cater, try them out!
author: Sarah K.

description:
They got yummy Kare Kare :)! I'm really picky when it comes to that entrée, and they did it right. 

As far as the portion, it was okay for $16. My fiancé and I gobbled it all up. So know that it isn't enough for a family of 5 unless you order something else. We usually order Filipino food from the peninsula, and they hook it up more. 

I ordered for pick up. I thought it was a bit inconvenient how they packaged it in a flat box container and by the time my fiancé got home- it was terribly leaking. But pro is they had the food ready in 10-15min. 

Note that you can only pay credit if it's $20 or more.

They are really nice but please don't expect them to be super professional over the phone. I'm Filipina American so I'm used to them chit chatting on the side as they took my order. 

Cheers!
author: Pamela B.

description: I'm typically not a fan of Filipino cuisine, but my experience here was excellent.  The service, and food, was really well done.
author: Regina T.

description: My favorite Filipino restaurant in my neighborhood. Their Kare-Kare and Beef Nilaga are my favorite. Had their longsilog recently and it was yummy. Loved the garlic rice the most and the plate presentation was nice.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
I can't tell you if the food is good or not, because I left pissed off. We get there at 6:10, and the place is busy. We stand where the hostess podium is, but no one acknowledged us. So, I went to the back and asked the waiter if we can have a table for 3. He said, "oh, i don't think we have any tables, can you just wait?" SURE
So, i stand and wait by the podium again for another 10 min. I see people leaving, but no one came and cleaned off the tables?!?!? So, I sat down in the waiting area with my husband and son and waited even longer. They close at 7pm. It is now 6:45pm! My husband gets up and asks the same guy "you close at 7 right?" 
"Yes we do."
"Ok, so should we just leave then?"
"How many people in your party?"
"My wife told you 3"
"Oh! I thought you guys left! Give me a few min."
WTF?!?!? I grabbed my family, and we left. Terrible! I wont ever go back. Hell no! Fuck that.
author: Val E.

description: This place is amazing! Great food, great people. Just amazing all around. We tried the tatluhan and everything was delicious, and since it's kamayan (hand, no utensils) it just added to the fun. They give you utensils, though, if that weird you out to eat with your hands lol. This is definitely a new go-to!
author: May M.

description: The platter for 2 is what's up. Add some bbq chicken to it if you and your fellow diner are hungry. REALLY friendly owner :)
author: Grant M.

description: I love this place... One of the few truly good... Great Filipino food. They make their own lumpia, not bought frozen. Their lechon kawali is really good as well as the Sisig baboy. If you like bitter melon, then the ampalaya con carne is a must try. The pancit bihon is also a standout! We come almost every week. We are only disappointed whenever they take vacation & we can't get our Pampanguena fix.
author: Amen C.

description:
We were looking for a brunch Filipino Style, decided to come here early 10:30ish. Reviews on yelp is spot on.  This place is great!  Lan, was very attentive and food was delivered within 15 minutes.

We ordered the Kamayan for 2 (eat with your hands for 2).  The presentation is very good.  The food is awesome!  Make sure you bring CASH!!! They DON'T take credit cards.
author: SFoodie P.

description: Amazing working family and delicious food! I feel like hugging all of them and calling them Tito and tita because I'm so satisfied every visit! Shoutout to tita Josie!
author: Rob S.

description: The owner is super nice. We got here way earlier than their open time, he still served us, and prepare for our food. We got the 2 people Kamayan Dalawahan, with a list of 10 items!!!! You don't have to eat with hands if you are not comfortable with it! Food is amazing!! And we will come again for sure :)
author: Fanny Z.

description: Delicious food at a great price. We ordered the Sisig and adobo around lunch time and were promptly served. The food is as good as it gets! Really flavorful and traditional Filipino cuisine. The adobo was especially good! Both lunch dishes came with garlic rice and some veggies. The rice was phenomenal and the lunch deals are a steal! Be aware that it is cash  only, however they do have an atm machine in the restaurant ($1.50 surcharge if I'm not mistaken). Can't wait to come back and try everything else!
author: Mark C.

description: Great place to get it all for a family party or for a nice lunch for work.
author: Lioness M.

description:
We saw this place through Yelp and decided to try it out
 We were so glad that we did because the food was great
 I had combinalot, which had fried fish and shrimp. My husband has barbeque binalot. Those two orders came with eggplant, salted egg, and tomato. I also love how they do not charge too much. The orders were less than $10 each. I am looking forward to come back to this place. I have never eaten so much in a restaurant, but in this reataurant I DID!
author: Pauline P.

description: I've bookmarked this place for a while and finally tried it. It was delish and well worth it. Only had the kamayan so that we could try a little bit of everything.  You eat with your hands so make sure all your party washes their hands.  There is a sink in the lobby use you don't to go to the bathroom. The service was good which makes the experience even better. The only con thing about here is that it "cash only."  If you come here, don't forget to bring it with you. They have an ATM in the lobby.
author: LZ T.

description: Amazing service! Best place to go for "Kamayan" experience!!!!! $50 for 4 people and they serve a good amount, ask for the secret sauce!!!!
author: Tiffany K.

description: The food was delicious. Try the group meal on the banana leaves. Those are delicious with plenty of selection! Will be back for more.
author: Ting Ting C.

description:
I came here with some Filipino coworkers, who said this place had great Filipino food.  At $7.50 for two items with rice, it's a great deal.  You can order one item for $6.00 instead.  
I blindly ordered and even though my coworkers told me the names, I don't remember them, except they've got long names.  However, they were all very good, especially the eggplant and pork with shrimp paste.
author: Karen L.

description: Best Filipino food in the city IMO. I get really bad cravings every few months or so for Filipino food, so I'm happy I found this place.
author: John V.

description: We order kamayan for 2 .. a lot of food.. BBQ pork, tilapia, unlimited rice, steamed vegetables, salty eggs, mangoes. . My kids enjoy eating pork BBQ.
author: Janice R.

description: My girl always orders tocino for me in the morning, homemade tocino here is hella good, this is the first time I've eaten here at the restaurant,  the food here is made fresh and taste delicious, not many restaurants where they have a sink to watch your hands than sit down and grub using your hands and chow down on the variety of food. The lumpia, the grilled bbq, grilled fish, steamed okra and broccoli,  salty egg and big portion of rice in the middle. My favorite was the suggestion of mixing the mango cubes, tomatoes,  and onions together, oh man was that delicious. There is so much full even with an empty stomach unable to finish the portion of food we were given and that order was for two. Thank you, definitely coming back with family next time here. Ma sarap!
author: Jayson V.

description: So delicious! New favorite place - such good, fresh food, great variety, and really nice people.
author: Sarah H.

description: My first stop into SF right out of the airport and I was craving some Filipino food.  Not just any type, Pampanguena style.  With my family being from that region, my standards for the cuisine tend to be a tad bit high.  So I was quite please to find that Pampanguena Cuisine wasn't too far off the beaten path.  Went here with two of my aunts, and all three of us were very much impressed with the dishes.  We started off with drinks---consisted of a huge coconut and the top was removed so that we could drink the fresh coconut milk.  We decided on the Kamayan for 3.  When they say for 3, it really is for a family of 5 or more because the portions are big.  It included a whole fried fish, squid, pork and chicken bbq (Filipino style), salted egg, side of onions, tomatoes and mango to mix with the food, grilled egg plant and so much more.  The dipping sauce sides were also a nice addition, this includes fish sauce, shrimp paste, and some infused vinegar.  We also ordered their sisig on a skillet, which was just as I had imagined it to be.  Lastly, we each had some turon (banana wrapped in an egg roll wrapper dipped in sugar and deep fried)----my favorite.  The owners Josie and her husband were so accommodating and helpful.  I'm glad we tried it out.
author: Luarnie B.

description: No need to fly to Pampanga Philippines! Just take your self to Pampaguena Cuisine! You will feel right at home to use your hands to eat the authentic Filipino cuisine! We are definitely going to make the trip again from Sacramento!
author: Mariza H.

description:
This was my first time eating Filipino food, so I was really excited. I know pretty much NOTHING about Filipino food except that it's supposed to be greasy. Also, lumpia are the most superior form of egg roll in the universe. As you can see, my knowledge is quite limited.

The nice part about this restaurant (along with the food) is the nice service. I felt like I was in a Filipino household! The cook/mom came around the tables, acting very motherly and very friendly. She really wanted to make sure you were enjoying your food. It reminded me a lot of my family, despite our non-Filipinoness. Enjoying the food is the best thing you can do to compliment the wonderful chef.

The food itself was great! We got the special platter for two people. It had fish, pork, veggies, fruit, rice - pretty much everything under the sun. I liked mixing some things and eating some things separately - it really leaves a lot to the imagination. And it's family style, so it's very friendly and really nice to eat with a date or a friend! You're supposed to eat it with your hands, but I opted for the fork and knife. Maybe next time I'll try my hands - that seems more fun :)

It was a great experience and I feel much more comfortable with Filipino food. I can't wait to try more dishes! And the restaurant confirmed my original beliefs: lumpia are the greatest form of egg rolls. Seriously. Delicious.
author: Jade R.

description: Omg!! First time here with my friends to celebrate a birthday! It wasn't crowded and I thought it was neat how there is a sink outiside of the restroom for you to wash your hands! The service was nice, but then again my friends speak Tagalog.  They ordered Dalawahan which was a super HUGE plate that had grilled talapia, chicken bbq, mango, lumpia,eggplants, tomatos, grilled pork, broccoli, etc. ad sauces to go with. They also have basically unlimited rice if you check in, so don't forget to do that! For soup, we had a tamarind based soup with meat and vegetables.  Dessert was simple but tasty. Note: Great for large gatherings or group parties. It's also a bit on the pricey end so make sure to bring at least $15-$20 with you when coming here. But being that it was my first tme having this kind of cuisine, it was totally wirth it!
author: Lena T.

description:
I found Pampanguena from searching the web, and I'm so glad I did! These guys are so nice! My party was yesterday...Food was delivered on time, Josie even let me use her chafing dishes, which was so helpful! Everyone LOVED the food & turon! 

Extremely happy with the food and service! I wish I would have known about you a long time ago, but I will definitely be ordering again, cant wait to try other dishes! Thank you so much =)
author: Leslie N.

description: Found the best kamayan ever. The drive is worth it. The grilled food are the best.  The portions are just right for the price. Definitely coming back and will use for parties.
author: Jovencio B.

description:
The food was great, the place was organized and clean, the owners and servers were friendly. 
We ordered the kamayan and was served on a basket. Unlike other kamayan places were they just dump your food on the table. This place has class. They don't make you feel like baboy! (Pigs).
I won't be embarrass to recommend this place to my friends, it's worth the drive from vallejo.
author: Rey D.

description:
Ambiance:  The loud flat-screen TV distracts your attention from the food.  If I wanted to eat food and watch TV, I would've just stayed home.  How about playing background Filipino music?

Food:  Expensive items that run from $12.00 to 16.00 for some of the big-ticket items, which do not require a lot of cooking technique other than fry, simmer, etc.  Pinakbet is good.  Bangus sisig is okay.  The cooking is not very skilled, I think.  

The drinks are also way too $$$.  Calamansi juice that I know comes from Safeway is $3.50 a glass!

Presentation:  Divey plating.  No garnishes, no TLC given to the food!  

Service:  Friendly, attentive.  Don't like it that it's cash only.  ATM inside the restaurant -- tacky.  That "Bahala Na" attitude prevails (if you know it), and it kinda shows in the overall dining experience of the patrons, myself included.  :-(
author: B Q.

description: Very tasty chicken adobo, friendly service.
author: Lisa B.

description:
My friend Val introduce me here since I am looking for a best Filipino restaurant here in San Francisco. I just got here last April from LA and being married to a white guy I need sometimes for my self, What I mean my own native food. I love the place, its cozy and the food is fantastic, worth every dollar we spent. I brought my husband here and they did not fail me and hubby love it much as I do.
Definitely I am still coming back once I get a chance away from my busy schedule.
author: Jisselle Marie R.

description: I called this place to get pricing for a tray of lumpia and the lady accused me of continually calling her for the last 1.5 hours. Uh no. This is the first time I've ever called your restaurant. And the last. Rude.
author: n m.

description: Great food btw friday, sat and sun they have a no spoon policy but for the people who doesnt wanna get dirty and still want to enjoy  the food ill suggest  to come in mon to thursday excellent experience i will definitely recomend this place for traditional filipino kamayan
author: Allan A.

description:
Takes credit cards at $10 minimum
The woman who serves my food is so sweet and always treats me like I'm a relative or friend. The food is delicious and seems fresh. 

I'm a fan of the adobo (natch), sinigang, and pretty much any other meat dish.
author: Candice B.
