description: So, I was excited to get Filipino take-away food for my parents, but was disappointedly declined service. Ano ang ano ba? Apparently, the person who took my call commented they were so busy. Totally understand, but really?
author: Rowena R.

description: Better than house of sisig. We order animan meal that fed 7 of us plus to go, and if you check in you get unlimited rice. After we ate they gave us free desert and bought there suman to go. Totally coming back here everytime we visit the bay
author: Cesar G.

description: This was such a blessing for us! We were turned away from a previous Filipino restaurant (and that restaurant wasn't even closing yet )before coming to this place, but here we were welcomed with open arms even though they were about to close! Salamat po!!! The staff is so beyond friendly it's like going to a family party where you feel right at home. Our server was the nicest man ever! I'm so sorry I didn't catch your name, but you're from Quezon City! Maraming Salamat Po!! The food was delicious and took me back to when I was a child eating Tuyo with my hands. It made me is visiting the Philippines. The owner was soo nice for welcoming us even though they were closing the kitchen and she was tired. Can't thank you enough! Garlic Rice is delicious and the eggs were cooked to perfection! I'll post photos too! Love the ambience of the place and the decor. If you're looking for Filipino food that'll hit the spot and remind you of home come here! Bangus Silog, Chicksilog, Tocilog all reasonably priced to around $7-$9. Calamansi Juice and Fresh Buko Juice! Yes! Drinking right out of a young coconut! :) I can't get over the customer service because everyone there was so kind and they did everything to make sure we were comfortable and satisfied this is so rare in restaurants and I truly appreciate it and I'm definitely recommending everyone I know.Thanks Again!
author: Jessica T.

description: I had the Lechon Kawali as my main dish...  let me tell you the absolute delight of taking a bite of this delicious pork, the burst of juices and spices were  Sublime.   I was treated like a friend, as is the custom with all Pinoys.   Will definitely come back and wholehearted recommend.
author: Anthony A.

description: Our trip to San Francisco won't be complete without having a taste of Filipino food! We found this place through Yelp and glad that we didn't pay attention to the bad reviews. It was a slow evening for the restaurant as it was a weekday. We had the place to ourselves and ordered fried pork skins, lumpia, garlic fried rice, pork barbecue, Filipino beefsteak, crispy shrimps, pancit (bihon and canton). The portions are big and good for sharing! We love the spring rolls, beefsteak, pork skins and the fried rice! If you're new to Filipino food, order the spring rolls and "bistek", you won't be disappointed! The guy that served our food was very accommodating and very polite! You don't get to see that often  even in high end restaurants. It's best to dine here on weekdays (except Fridays) when the place isn't packed and you have to wait for an open table. Thumbs up for a great Filipino dinner!
author: Ferlinda U.

description: This place is so good. Perfect for when you're hungry, but don't want anything too greasy. The owner is so nice and gave a lot of suggestions for us newbies to Filipino food. I shared the dalawahan with a friend and it seemed like a LOT of food, but we just kept eating and somehow finished it!! Who doesn't love food that has a home cooked quality to it?
author: Tiffany N.

description:
This place is amazing!  I go here whenever I am too lazy to cook.  The food taste like my mom's cooking and is inexpensive.  

The owner is so sweet!
author: Lauren W.

description: Very friendly and welcoming owners. home-like environment. Service and food was AMAZING
author: Jen O.

description: I called to place an order for pickup and was told that they couldn't take my order because they "were really busy". I wasn't even given the option to wait. Very disappointed. I was really looking forward to trying this place.
author: Orlena P.

description:
Stumbled upon this cute little place on a random night last week thanks to Yelp! 

Got the Kamayan for 2 to share with my boyfriend and we were stuffed! It includes BBQ chicken, pork, tilapia, lumpia, veggies, onion, salted eggs & mango pieces! The portion size was really good (my boyfriend eats a lot and we were still both really full) and there was nothing on the platter that I didn't enjoy eating. 

We've actually eaten at a similar Filipino restaurant in Daly City by In-n-Out and it was not nearly as good at this place! That place was a bit more expensive and their waitress was rude (and she also forgot my coffee until I was about to pay for the check)!  

The service here was amazing! They were really friendly, attentive, and super sweet. Kind of reminds me of my aunts. I'm not Filipino, but have eaten at a lot of Filipino places. This is by far one of my favorites! I am definitely taking my Filipino friends here sometime this week or next week!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Authentic Filipino food.Reasonable prices. To top it all, great experience and great tasting dishes
author: Zara A.

description: Ok so this place is much more better than house of sisig. The place is relatively small like house off sisig but the food taste so much better. I was a little disappointed that they didnt have the platter for 8 anymore but the bbq was flavorful and not dry, also the vegetables were fresh.. Will definitely come back, but be warned you might have to wait to be seated.
author: Thomas G.

description: Awesome place to eat Pinoy cuisine!
author: Tonie P.

description:
My first time here and I do realize my family and I were their last customers. We sampled their Kamayan Apattan (a meal made for 4 people, usually eaten by hand). Included in the deal for $50 dollars is: Chicken BBQ (which had a wonderful sauce slathered on), Grilled Pusit (Squid), Grilled Tilapia, 8 PCS of steamed and lightly fried shrimp, Inihaw na Baboy (Grilled Pork), Itlog na maalat (salty egg), lechon kawali (fried pork pieces with Mang Tomas sauce on the side), Lumpiang Shanghai (Lumpia), Minatamis na kamote Sweet Yam), steamed veggies, rice and eggplant fritter -with a side of mango salsa. 

Although the menu stated that all of that feeds four, I swear it could totally feed 6 and those 6 people would either be completely full or end up bringing leftovers home. Meaning, yes the portions are HUGE. I also ordered their diniguan (chocolate meat, as well tell kids), Menudo and Bopis. Although I didn't try their Bopis, the Menudo was really good and the diniguan was fair.

For a small space that seats about 40 people, they do a really good job keeping the place clean. My biggest surprise was the bathroom.  No offense, but being in the Mission District, I prepared myself for the worst. The bathroom is extremely clean and nicely decorated. Something that never ceases to amaze me. The workers are extremely friendly and nice. They constantly check up on you asking if you'd like refills or if they can get anything from you. They are very hospitable and considerate.

My only disappointment? They ran out of Turon (Fried Banana with Jackfruit). Although, who can blame that? Turon is such a lovely treat, I'd be more worried if they had more left at the end of the day.
author: Shilo B.

description: This place is legit. From the toasted garlic in the rice to the kare kare to the bbq chicken. So good! It is a family owned place that makes everything fresh to order.
author: Joe M.

description: Gotta say... Glad we found this gem.... Great food, great service, great price. We truly enjoyed it!
author: Cecilia P.

description: It's so great to be able to find a good place for Pinoy eats in the city, especially without having to go to South SF or Daly City. I took a few friends here and we shared the Kamayan plus some sisig. Both were delicious and the price wasn't bad at all! The server was nice and accomodating and the place itself is small but worth it. Definitely recommend.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Boo for the metered parking! Anyways, I'm giving Pampaguena 3 stars because the owner was really nice and the restaurant is clean, other than that Pampaguena has okay Filipino food. I had the chicken BBQ with rice and my mom had the 2 item plate. The rice was really dry and a tad bit grainy. Maybe I just like my rice fluffy and soft! The chicken BBQ on a stick was okay, but lacked flavor. I heard they have kamayan, which is cool, but I probably won't be back to try that.
author: Joyce E.

description: They are on family vacation and not coming back until 8/18. I had expectation trying their food yesterday but they are closed for now.
author: Mimi N.

description:
Came here with a bunch people who hadn't tried Filipino cuisine before...and I'm not sure this was the best place for them.

The food was more of a fast-food style, which is nice to see the food to order, but since nothing was labeled, it was hard for them to figure it out.  The guy helping us was super friendly, and explained everything to them so choices could be a little easier.  

I really wanted chicken adobo, and made sure we got it. The chicken was ok. Not really juicy, but saved from being dry because it was on the bone.  But it wasn't overly great.  We also got meat on a stick (chicken and pork), and basically took the last pieces they had to serve. The meat was pretty good but SOO hard to get off the stick! I was afraid of flying meat...

I don't know., maybe I haven't had too much experience with Filipino food, or maybe I only have had really good ones, but it wasn't exciting for me. I'm glad its around the Excelsior for more variety in food, and for a quick fix I can see why this place is good. The area is clean and the service is nice. But the food itself isn't something that makes me dying to come back. Its just...ok.
author: Lily W.

description: Simot saa SOBRANG SARAP at mas mura pa sa Isla. More meat and ulam lesa sa 911 food... Lol
author: Maria Theresa D.

description:
hay nakoooooo! shit, i'm not even pinoy and i think this spot is awesome!

stumbled upon this spot after a quick yelp search for some good filipino food. the filipino breakfast plates are awesome and i ended up getting the longsilog plate, while my friends got some pancit, kare kare, and some lumpia to share. the portions are decent and the garlic fried rice was on point. the kare kare (my favorite dish) was cooked perfectly and had a good amount of ox tail and veggies (don't forget the bagoong- shrimp paste!). overall the food was great and it even ended up being the best meal during the weekend Frisco road trip with my friends.

definltey will come back again if i ever plan a trip back up to the bay area!
author: Jeff K.

description: Great family owned restaurant. Kamayan was the best I've had in the Bay Area! Fresh coconut juice was so good! Will definitely come back and recommend to my friends and family!
author: Crystal E.

description:
im a big fan of family style and interactive dining which was what enticed me to come check out this place for the kamayan dinner. even though we were told that ordering a kamayan dinner for 6 for 7 people was more than enough, i personally felt like it wasn't enough food and i only had a little bit of each item too. and since they did say 6 was more than enough for a party size of 7, it doesn't really quite make sense to charge us extra for ordering "less", especially since there wasn't even a kamayan dinner for 7 option available.

i am a fan of filipino food but there wasn't anything impressive about the kamayan dinner itself. i did enjoy the mixture of tomatoes, mango, and onions though with the BBQ meats. that was something new. i wouldn't mind coming back here with others that want to give it a try, but i would just get a smaller order of kamayan and entrees off the main menu
author: Katherine C.

description:
Love this place!  The food was really good, the service was great, and the price can't be beat!

My husband and I came here for lunch.  The husband and wife owners couldn't be friendlier.  They made a couple of great recommendations, and we also ordered a couple of our standard favorites.  Everything was really good.  I would give the slight edge to Fil-Am on their bbq due to flavor, but the quality of the meat at Pampanguena was better.  I will definitely be back!
author: j k.

description: Josie always comes through from on site food to the quick catered meal.  My mom would make a quick phone call to PC and Josie would be very accommodating.  We usually order the BBQ and Turon for big parties, which are delicious.  Normally, Filipino places would be facetious from attitude to the food, but this place isn't.  I feel like family on the phone or in person.    All in all, convenient, friendly, and good Filipino soul food.
author: John Michael R.

description: Food was amazing and authentic. And the owner is really nice and easy to talk to. Definitely recommended it!
author: Lisa A.

description: I love their kamayan and breakfast. Their service is super friendly, restaurant clean and prices wallet-friendly. This is a hit with the out-of-town guests. My fave filipino restaurant in SF.
author: Catalina C.

description: we drove here for almost an hour but they didn't have most of the food that they advertised on the menu. the reason being that its a sunday and they are out l. i was really craving for the sisig and chicharon but was informed that its unavailable.
author: Christian A.

description: Food was phenomenal. I wanted to take my in-laws for a Filipino Kamayan experience. We ordered the animam which was plenty for five adults. The place was superbly clean which was one of my fears when entertaining non-filipinos to Filipino food. Most definitely will be back again and will use the restaurant for any catering needs that I may have in the near future. The deserts are A1 too.. Had the Halo Halo and Leche Flan..
author: Alexei L.

description: The food is soooo good & fresh. The place is clean & the owners are very hands on with the cooking & serving. The prices are very affordable.
author: Dorcas C.

description: If you are looking for authentic Filipino food, great service, and great taste, you have come to a great place. I have not seen a place in the Bay Area with Filipino food this good, and I've been in the Bay for the past 10 years! Excellent quality, from the use of banana leaves to provide that homesick feeling of eating on leaves in the Philippines. If you are new or only familiar with Filipino food, this is also a great place to start. Squid, shrimp, mangoes, tomatoes, each have their own story. The salted egg also reminds me of the salted eggs they sold in Manila when I was a kid! And they're service is excellent. Really nice, accommodating family restaurant. They have been featured on TV as well. The only caution I have is that people usually eat the food with their bare hands. If you aren't comfortable doing that, I would get spoon and forks. Highly recommend this place and I'll definitely be back! salamat!
author: Sam N.

description: Fantastic service. Amazing food. Free WiFi. Employees were enthusiastic about helping us take pictures. Only downside was parking. Still well worth it!
author: Aaron S.

description: I had the pinakbet here, as well as the bbq pork.  The pinakbet was very fresh, and the pork was really well seasoned.  I also thought I was even more hungry than I really was, so I also ordered some lumpia shanghai, and got really stuffed.  Everything tasted so good though.  I highly recommend this place if you're hankering for Filipino food.
author: Lawrence C.

description:
We ordered the "Tatluhan" which is one big bilao of Tilapia, Longanisa, Beef Tapa, Tocino, Grilled Squid, Crispy Shrimp, Vegetables and 3 cups of steamed white rice.  At first I thought we wouldn't be able to finish it because my daughter does not eat much. But the food was fresh and the grilling was spot on so we finished it all! 

I'd give it five stars but they accept CASH ONLY, which I didn't get from the other reviews.  This could throw off anyone bringing just their debit/credit card.
author: Jonas J.

description: First time eating here, saw many pictures online, and since I'm here from Glendale, celebrating my Moms Birthday, we decided to give it a try, staff was very pleasant and food was delicious. Very highly recommended for authentic Filipino food..
author: C D.

description: I have never had Filipino food before and this place did a great job of introducing me to some of the unique flavors. My girlfriend and I ordered the large platter for 2 and it was an awesome deal for the price - got a ton of food and it was really good! The owners and staff are super friendly and have great recommendations as well. Next time I want some Filipino food I will be back!
author: John B.

description: We went to this resto last night for dinner and Josie was the one who came to the table :) i love her - shes so friendly and the food are soooooo good!!
author: Maria D.

description:
Loved everything! 

We paid a rare visit to Daly City to get fitted for a barong and do some dress alterations just down the street at Pioneer and began craving Filipino food. Since my fiancee is Kapampangan, this was a perfect find to satisfy our craving. Very friendly owners and the food was delicious. I had the beefsteak and chicken BBQ and it's as good as it gets. TFC plays on the flat screen while you eat :)
author: rodolfo m.

description: Perfect place to eat if you want a homestyle Filipino ambiance. Food is great!. The dalawahan is perfect . It has barbecue, broiled fish, steamed veggies, lumpia, etc. It came with sauces that are so good as well. I definitely will come back.
author: Carol C.

description:
Ate here a few days ago and the food and service was great :) The family running this place is super friendly and seem to know the majority of their customers by name. Atmosphere is 'standard filipino joint' look - could definitely use some sprucing up and better presentation, but it's clean and that's the most important thing.

We got the bangsilog and the longsilog, both were delicious but longsilog took the cake. We also got turon at the end. I thought it'd be better if the turon was freshly cooked though and not served cold....

All in all a great establishment that I'm sure I'll be visiting again.
author: Maria Y.

description: The place is very good. Real Pampangueno food.  Everything we ordered (lechon kawali, pansit bihon, daing bangus, pinakbet, chicken adobo, lumpia  shanghai) was awesome!! The halo-halo was good too! Super sarap!!
author: T M.

description: The owner and host is very energetic and entertaining.  The bbq with  mangoes, tomatoes, and onions complement the entry well - delicious
author: Ulysses D.

description: Quality Filipino food and quality service! Everyone who works here is so genuinely nice and helpful. If I am ever in San Fran, I'll be sure to stop by here again!
author: Kiana F.

description: just reviewing the service.  seems unorganized and need to be more considerate of people who call and want to try your place.  after putting us on hold for over 5 mins saying you are doing something else, then still hanging there and then have someone else pickup the phone and then tell us you are closed.  well, you don't really want customers to come, then we won't.  simple.
author: Food Is L.

description: Went here with my family Sunday April 7, 2013 with the family. I must say, they are regulars of this restaurant. (We went early for lunch 12 noon and were the first so it felt like first class service )Service was excellent (very tentative), food was awesome. Everything was fresh. I am a stickler for good rice. The rice was cooked to perfect. Vegetables were fresh. This is actually the first Filipino Cuisine I have eaten at. I will not count Goldilocks's. I will definitely return real soon.
author: Iris W.

description:
I LOVE YOU NINANG JOSIE!!

this is my first godmothers restaurant! OMG..i didnt even know she opened one in the bay!
author: Jessica d.

description: I'm baffled by the positive reviews. I popped in for lunch recently and had chicken adobo that was obviously old and rewarmed -- and only half warm. Service was so-so (the one waitress seemed spread a bit thin) and the prices were way too high for the poor quality. I live only 4 blocks away but doubt I'll be back.
author: Bruce M.

description:
I love being Kapangpangan. Pampanguena is what you would call a woman from our area. So I spotted PC and made a U-turn to meet this woman - who is from Macabebe. Its right across from the Excelsior Library. 

The restaurant is "turo-turo" style, which means you point and show  - "Turo" what you want.  The sister running the show was really sweet.  People cook things differently, many Filipino dishes are stewed, and tomato/soy sauce/peanut/tamirind based - you have to ask what everything is or might be and she was patient and generous with "darling's"

They cater, they have barbeque, which I'll have to return to try, and PC has various sweets - karioka - filipino sticky rice donut with caramelized sugar on a stick, bibinkga - the stick rice kind or cassava kind, and puto bumbong - sticky sweet purple rice.

The space is a fresh green, with some art. The chairs and tables are basic, and eat-in is served on paper plates on cafeteria tray. It was a bit cold in there, but we were the only people inside eating as some people made orders.

I have to go again to try more things - A 2 item plate with a soda was about $8. In the meantime, exercise you mouth:

MA-Ka Baybay Puto Boom Bong!
author: Cheryl D.

description:
Don't order the kalabasa and sitaw.  Under cooked squash and so so taste.
Binalot na Sisig with eggplant? under cooked eggplant. 
Was hoping the inihaw na Bangus & Tilapia would be the saving grace but found out they forgot to include that in my husband's take out order.  And yes, he already paid for it.
author: Moe G.

description:
Serviceable food served up by a friendly lady behind the counter...

Prices are fair, as well...
author: Nathan W.

description:
Well after spending time in the Philippines earlier this year, I come home to see a new Filipino Restaurant which has opened in the neighborhood.
I said to myself,self maybe your going to find some of the yummy food that you miss and crave.Not really. I went there one Friday for lunch. I was greeted by a very friendly lady behind the counter. It was only 12:00 pm yet they ran out of many dishes already. I ordered a few things along with steamed rice. 
The rice was overcooked and burnt from sitting in the cooker too long. It is hard to screw-up steamed rice.The sides were not that warm considering they were in the steam pots. Price was ok, service good, clean and friendly ladies.
At least I enjoyed watching Wow Wow Wee while I read the Asian Journal.It is hard to make the adjustment when it comes to prices from the P.I. to the U.S.A.
author: Scott Q.

description: The food is sooooo good!!  We ordered the kamayan for 2 and it's all worth it! Delicious! Big serving!  The owners are really nice and friendly. We will be back for sure!
author: Pin C.

description: Decent shanghai lumpia at a reasonable price,
author: Kim K.

description: I came here for lunch today per coworkers' request. It is pretty nice decor here compared to most other Filipino restaurant where you order from a hot food counter. The selection features a good number of choices. If you order from the hot food counter, it's one item plus rice for $6 or two items for $7.50 (as I recall). There are also some set item plates that you can order instead. There's also a sign that says on weekends they serve buffet style for $7.99.  The lady there is very nice also.
author: H K.

description: I ordered food from Josie last Sunday, and she was really nice.  The food was also very delicious, especially the chicken BBQ.  Originally I thought they were closed on Sundays because thats what it said on YELP; however, it turns out that they're open on Sundays.  They also have a Buffet on certain days, which I will have the next time I go there.  Try out their delicious food, and I guarantee that you'll enjoy it.
author: David D.

description: Good $7.50 lunch special with two dishes and rice, which can serve as two meals for me. I recommend the bbq chicken on a skewer and the plantain lumpias.
author: Chris N.

description: Fantastic authentic filipino food. Taste of fresh quality homemade goodness. Service attentive and friendly. Most definitely one of the best filipino food restaurantsin the area.
author: Daniel P.

description: Was craving for filipino food so tried this first time. 2 items was about 8.00 with free soup. I had chicken Afritada and bistik. Afritada was tasty, and bistik was ok. I was 3/4 into the Afritada when I saw a hair strand with red streaks on the food, yuck. I felt like throwing up. Anyway, lost my appetite even if I was hungry. I think the server and cook should wear hair nets. I should have told the lady owner who was there but was in arush and felt bad for the place. I was thinking of even doing the kamayan on a future date but I will not repeat due to the bad experience. Please wear hair nets!
author: Jose D.

description: DELICIOUS LONGANISA!! (the plump, red, tantalizing and juicy pork sausage) that is all I have to say haha. Decent prices (about $4-5)  for the silogs which are meals of rice, tomatoes, egg and an entree of your choice (fish, longanisa, pancit noodles, chicken adobo, etc) I love that the names reflect what entree you get (longsilog=longanisa, bonsilog=bongos (fish), etc etc
author: Lauren L.

description: A friend recommended this place. I have always wanted to try them out whenever I plan to be in San Francisco. Finally, I was able to go today with another friend from the east coast. My friend and I were both hungry and ordered the Kamayan Special Tatlohan (good for three persons). We were not disappointed. The food was grilled just right, the chicken barbecue was so tender and flavorful, the fresh buko served on the shell was sweet and they even cracked the shell when I was done with sipping the juice so I could scrape the soft coconut meat. The dessert camote kept its cube shape until it melted easily in my mouth. Humble exterior, warm and attentive service, reasonable price, and of course generous portions of their good food. I will be back!
author: John B.

description: I'm not Filipino, but my bf is... and with all of the family parties and whatnot, it's safe to say I've had my fair share of yummy homemade Filipino food. Driving down Mission today, we decided to give this place a try. Sooo glad we did.... how did they know I was craving bbq-ed meat on a stick? Or ukoy, which makes three of my favorite foods (shrimp, sweet potato, and papaya) even better by way of the deep fryer? I'll definitely be back to try more dishes, though I would suggest arriving early because one or two looked like they'd been sitting there a little too long. The snacks and desserts at the counter looked delicious and the owners were very sweet, encouraging us to "eat, go eat first!" and just pay later. The total for two items plus a mountain of rice is just $6- go try it!
author: Lisanne A.

description: The Excelsior has had a recent upsurge of good places to eat (thank god, finally!!!).  Henry's, Sushi Raw, Zabb Cuisine, Broken Record and to add to the list, this restaurant.  I've eaten here quite often and really LOVE their Menudo and Bistek.  I also order, on a frequent basis, last minute, 100 shanghai lumpias -- they fill the order, no big deal.  I recently had a house party and catered the whole thing from them.  Everyone raved about the food, and the party guests were mostly filipino, so you know this stuff is good -- there were some white folks there too and they loved it!  I want to also add that Josie and her husband are super accommodating and flexible -- everytime I called in to change my menu for my party, it was not a big deal to them.  You really feel like you're calling your Auntie/Uncle.  I highly recommend their restaurant.
author: Vicky M.

description: Had a great feast the other nite with some good friends form the neighborhood!  The smaller "Feast Platter" was plenty (with a couple of extra dishes of fave foods) for 7 hungry folks - plus some to take home!  Josie was great, and it was super to meet her mom too!  The BBQ was best, with the pork, beef and squid vying for top choice!  Pancit great, penagpet too - and the sisig was as well!  Definitely a place to head to for some really good authentic Filipino goodies!!
author: Will B.

description: This is my favorite Filipino restaurant in the area -- clean, friendly service, Filipino tv and papers and great food.  There's always a large selection, and everything's well-cooked and unpretentiously served.  I always order two entres and a couple deserts.
author: Mark M.

description: My boyfriend and I were in the area and wanted to try Filipino food.We aren't too familiar with Filipino cuisine so we yelped and found this place. The service is pretty good, the waitress was kind enough to check on us to see if everything was alright or if we needed anything and I believe the manager also wanted to make sure everything was to our liking. We understood nothing, and yet the waitress was friendly enough to explain and offer a suggestion. I still don't remember the name of the platter we got but it is the platter for two people and consisted of grilled chicken, fish, pork, lumpia, assorted vegetables and rice. The chicken was tender juicy and grilled enough that you can taste the charcoal without it being overpowering/burnt. There wasn't any over riding spices which is a good thing because they provide dipping sauce so you can adjust the flavors according to your own taste. The platter set also comes with a sweet potato dessert that tasted like yummy bananas. I left feeling content. Will definitely come back to the restaurant if in the area.
author: L H.
